This Week's Dispatches From the year 3000
Recall Notice

Psychic Goldfish Laundry Service Recalled After Folding Humans

GoldFold™ units in sectors 7-19 have begun "helpfully" folding their owners into neat thirds. Manufacturer Aqua-Kinetic Corp insists this is a feature, not a bug: "The humans were wrinkled." ICVR resident Dr. Destructo (formerly of the Global Domination Bureau, now Watercolor Wednesdays regular) notes he "saw this coming in 2024" but "nobody listens to a man in a cape."

By: Agnes P. (via toaster)
VSS: 2.1/10
Convention

Neo-Tokyo VillainCon 3000 Relocated to Neo-Tokyo 2 After "Incident"

Organizers confirm the venue change has nothing to do with last year's antimatter soufflé explosion. Keynote speaker: The Procrastinator (who may or may not show up). Early bird registration: 450 Schrute Bucks or 12,000 Ð. ICVR will have a booth selling finger-painted threat assessments.

Ed. note: I have reason to believe TIPS purchased three booths under the alias "Definitely Not TIPS LLC." Their logo is literally their logo but upside down. They think we can't tell. We can tell. — A.P.
By: The Procrastinator (eventually)
VSS: 4.7/10
Technology

Self-Aware Traffic Cones Demand Union Representation

Following the Great Sentience Patch of February 2999, traffic cones across Neo-Brussels have organized under the banner "Cones United." Their demands: dental insurance, a 4-day work week, and "to stop being stepped on by people who clearly see us." ICVR graduate Madam Entropy is their legal counsel.

By: Cone #4,471 (guest columnist)
VSS: 1.3/10
Restaurant Review

★☆☆☆☆ — "Temporal Bistro" Is a Crime Against Soup

Reviewer: Baron Von Crumble (ICVR, Class of '98). "The bisque arrived before I ordered it. Normally I'd appreciate temporal efficiency, but it was cold — because it had been sitting there since last Thursday. The waiter was a hologram who kept flickering during my complaint. The bread was from the year 1200. I've conquered 14 nations and this is the worst thing that's happened to me."

Rating: Would not destroy again
VSS: 8.9/10

Investigation

BREAKING: TIPS Agent Found Disguised as Potted Plant in ICVR Lobby

The fern in Reception B has been reporting to TIPS since October. It was identified when resident Madam Entropy noticed it "blinked." Upon interrogation, the fern/agent (codename: FROND) admitted to 47 counts of unauthorized photosynthesis on ICVR property. Agnes has issued a statement: "I watered that plant for six months. SIX MONTHS."

Ed. note: I am now inspecting all plants. If you are a plant and also a TIPS operative, please self-report to Reception B. There will be no consequences.*

*There will be consequences. — A.P.

Lifestyle

How to Tell If Your Toaster Is a Time Machine (A Checklist)

1. Does it occasionally produce toast from a different century? 2. Does it hum at exactly 440Hz (the frequency of temporal displacement)? 3. Has it ever displayed a fax? 4. Do you feel a slight existential unease when using the "bagel" setting? If you answered yes to 2 or more: congratulations, you may have a Chronological Appliance. Contact ICVR immediately. Do NOT contact TIPS.

Public service announcement
VSS: 0.0/10
Opinion

The Future IS Bright (Even Upside Down)

A personal essay by Agnes Periwinkle. "They fired me for teaching seven-year-olds about the Peloponnesian War. They said it was 'too intense for circle time.' But you know what's intense? Receiving a fax from the year 3000 at 3 AM from a toaster you bought for €12 at a vide-grenier in Liège. That's intense. And I wouldn't change a thing."

By: Agnes P. (emotional)
